To find the number of telephone poles to the right of a truck, we need to know the position of the truck on the road.

Let's assume the truck is traveling north on a two-lane road with one telephone pole per mile.

If the truck is traveling at a speed of 60 miles per hour, it will cover a distance of 1 mile in 160/60 = 0.25 hours or 2.5 minutes.

Therefore, the truck will pass 4 telephone poles (1 mile / 2.5 minutes) to the right of it during the time it takes to cover 1 mile.
So, the answer is (C) 4.
